Increased economic growth: A highly educated workforce is essential for the growth of any economy. With access to free, high-quality education, individuals would be able to acquire the skills and knowledge needed to contribute to the economy in a meaningful way. This would lead to an increase in productivity, innovation, and overall economic growth.

Improved social mobility: Education is a key factor in social mobility. With access to free, high-quality education, individuals from all socio-economic backgrounds would have the opportunity to improve their prospects and move up the social ladder. This would lead to a more equitable society.

Better health outcomes: Education is linked to better health outcomes. With access to free, high-quality education, individuals would have the knowledge and skills needed to make informed decisions about their health. This would lead to better health outcomes and a reduction in healthcare costs.

Increased civic engagement: Education is linked to increased civic engagement. With access to free, high-quality education, individuals would have the knowledge and skills needed to participate in the democratic process. This would lead to a more engaged and informed citizenry.

Greater environmental sustainability: Education is linked to greater environmental sustainability. With access to free, high-quality education, individuals would have the knowledge and skills needed to make informed decisions about the environment. This would lead to a more sustainable future.
